Summary: The Lord's Preface to the Doctrine and Covenants
Verse: Whether by my own voice or by the voice of my servants, it is the same
Context: John Whitmer had compiled the revelations in preparation for printing, but the book needed an introduction. The best writers in the Church (William McLellin, Sidney Rigdon, and Oliver Cowdery) tried and failed so the Lord revealed this preface to Joseph Smith

Summary: The coming of Elijah to turn the hearts of the children to the fathers
Verse: And [Elijah] shall plant in the hearts of the children the promises made to the fathers, and the hearts of the children shall turn to their fathers
Context: Moroni appears in the middle of the night when Joseph is 17

Summary: 116 Pages Pt 1. It is not the work of God that is frustrated, but the work of men
Verse: Remember, remember that it is not the work of God that is frustrated by the work of men
Context: Martin Harris was a prosperous farmer in the Palmyra area, who was the age of Joseph's parents. Lucy Harris was causing lots of trouble at home and Martin wanted to show her the manuscript to bring peace. After asking three times, Joseph agrees to let Martin take the manuscript which eventuallly is stolen from him.
Content: But remember, God is merciful; therefore repent… and thou art still chosen, and art again called to do the work

Summary: Joseph Smith Senior is called to embark in the service of God
Verse: Therefore, oh ye that embark in the service of God, see that ye serve Him with all your heart, might, mind, and strength
Context: Early in 1829, Joseph Sr. makes the trip from Manchester/Palmyra to Harmony Pennsylvania, longing to know what the Lord wanted him to do.
Consequences: The revelation turned Father Smith into a farmer of souls. He had been tight-lipped to Oliver Cowdery, the school teacher who was boarding with his family but when Joseph returned home, he told Oliver about the marvelous work about to come forth.

Summary: 116 Pages Pt 2. Martin Harris is forgiven and encouraged to have faith, even without a witness.
Verse: Behold, if they will not believe My [the Lord's] words, they would not believe you [Joseph] if it were possible that you should show them all these things [the plates].
Context: About a year after Martin Harris went to Pennsylvania to scribe for Joseph, he arrived there again. He said his neighbors were building a lawsuit against Martin unless he denounced Joseph. Martin said he needed evidence that the plates were real.
Content: The Lord says to Martin that the testimony of three witnesses of the Book of Mormon shall go forth and if Martin humbles himself, the Lord will grant unto him a view of the things which he desires to see.
Consequences: This revelation reoriented Martin. He returned home and bore such a powerful testimony in the court that the judge ruled to drop all charges. Eventually Martin repented enough to become of the three witnesses

Summary: Invitation to Oliver Cowdery to join the work
Verse: Cast your mind upon the night that you cried unto me in your heart... Did I not speak peace to your mind concerning the matter?
Context: Oliver Cowdery was a school teacher boarding with the Smith family during the 1827-1828 school year. He heard the stories and decided to go help Joseph. In the meantime, Joseph had been praying for a scribe.
Consequences: Within days of Oliver's arrival, they start the translation and do the whole thing in a matter of months.

Summary: Joseph and Oliver Cowdery learn about revelation through a translation of a record of John the Beloved, revealed in the hat method
Verse: Therefore I will make him [John the Beloved] as flaming fire and a ministering angel.
Context: Joseph and Oliver are learning a lot about revelation. Joseph looks into the Urim and Thummim [probably in his hat] and sees an ancient parchment which he translates

Summary: Oliver given a chance to translate
Verse: Behold I will tell you in your mind and in your heart, by the Holy Ghost which shall come upon you and which shall dwell in your heart.
Content: You [Oliver] have another gift, which is the gift of Aaron [Diving Rod; working with the sprout]
Controversy: Lehi had a Liahona, Aaron had a divining rod, Mosiah used seer stones. God can use physical objects to communicate including divining rods and seer stones that shine in the darkness of a hat.

Summary: Oliver fails at translating and returns to scribe
Verse: You did not continue as you commenced… You supposed that I would give when you took no though save it was to ask me...You must study it out in your mind, if it is right, I will cause that your bosom shall burn within you. If it be not right… you shall have a stupor of thought.
Consequences: God's plans are not fragile. Joseph has sufficient strength to make up Oliver's failure (v.12). We make mistakes and ignore promptings but that doesn't mean we need to cut up our patriarchal blessing. God makes plans that are sufficient to make up for our weakness

Summary: 116 Pages Pt 3. The Lord reveals Satan's plan to use the stolen pages to undermine the translation
Verse: Pray Always, that you may come off conqueror; yea that you may conquer Sata, and that you may escape the hands of the servants of Sata that do uphold his work
Controversy: The leading theory, outside the Church, for the origin of the Book of Mormon is the Solomon Spaulding manuscript. It seems that those who stole the plates had a similar plan. And it was a good enough plan that Joseph did not retranslate that part. But God had prepared for this by prompting Nephi to make a duplicate record 2,400 years earlier.

Summary: Hyrum is called to the work.
Verse: Seek not to declare my word, but first seek to obtain my word and then shall your tongue be loosed

Summary: Joseph Knight is called to the work
Verse: No one can assist in this work except he shall be humble and full of love, having faith, hope, and charity, being temperate in all things, whatsoever be entrusted to his care
Context: Joseph Smith met the Knight family when he was hired as a day laborer during the Colesville/Josiah Stoal/Treasure Hunt and lived with them while courting Emma (a distance of 20 miles from Harmony). In May 1829, Joseph and Oliver needed paper and supplies and Joseph Knight brought them provisions. It is likely during that visit that this revelation occurred
Consequences: Joseph Smith said, "For fifteen years has he been faithful and true, and even handed, and exemplary, and virtuous, and kind…It shall be said of him that this man was a faithful man in Israel; Therefore his name shall never be forgotten

Summary: John the Baptist restores Aaronic Priesthood Keys
Verse: Upon you my fellow servants, in the name of Messiah I confer the Priesthood of Aaron, which holds the keys of the ministering of angels, and of the gospel of repentance, and of baptism by immersion for the remission of sins; and his shall never be taken again from the earth until the sons of Levi do offer again an offering unto the Lord in righteousness.
Content: Baptism by immersion: This section came after Joseph and Oliver translated the visit of the Savior to the Nephites and gave them authority to baptize…. Offering of the sons of Levi: In 1842, Joseph connects this prophecy to a book of the dead prepared through templ work (128:24). The sons of Levi may be less about lineage and more about function (i.e. temple service)

Summary: David Whitmer called to the work 1st of the Whitmer brother sections
Context: Oliver knew the Whitmer family so when persecution got bad in Harmony, Joseph and Oliver moved to Fayette (about 30 miles from Palmyra) to finish the translation
Content: David is counseled to endure to the end and become a witness of the things which you shall hear and see.
Consequences: David Whitmer becomes one of the 3 witnesses and even the President of the Church in Missouri before leaving in the Kirtland apostasy. He never returns to the Church but never denies his testimony either. On his deathbed, he shares his testimony again. He writes editorials in newspapers. As a witness, his testimony is more powerful because he left. So he did endure in his witness to the end, as counseled in the section

Summary: John Whitmer called to the work. 2nd of Whitmer brother sections
Verse: The thing of most worth will be to declare repentance
Consequences: John and Peter were two of the 8 witnesses. John was the first appointed Church Historian (47)

Summary: Peter Whitmer called to the work. 3rd of Whitmer brother sections
Verse: The thing of most worth will be to declare repentance
Consequences: John and Peter were two of the 8 witnesses. Peter died in 1836 before the excommunication of the Whitmer family in 1838. Based on other interactions, he might have been one to stay faithful or encourage the Whitmer's to stay

Summary: Three Witnesses are called to testify of what they have seen. Including the plates, the sword of Laban, and the Urim and Thummim
Content: You shall have a view of the plates, breastplate, sword of Laban, and Urim and Thummim… You shall testify … that Joseph Smith will not be destoyed
Consequences: Although each of these men left the Church, they never denied their witness. Oliver and Martin eventually come back but David does not. Each of them testified on their death bed of the truthfulness of the book of Mormon.
Recipient: Oliver Cowdery, Martin Harris, David Whitmer

Summary: Three Witnesses will call the Apostles. Remember the worth of Souls is Great in the Sight of God
Verse: Remember the Worth of Souls is Great in the Sight of God… The Lord suffered death and the pain of all men that they might repent and come unto him … If you should labor all your days and bring one soul, how great shall be your joy.
Context: Joseph asked Oliver to draft a sort of constitution for the Church (which eventually became section 20). Oliver wanted some guidance and asked for a revelation

Summary: Martin Harris is asked to sacrifice his wealth for the printing of the book of Mormon. Jesus shares a first-hand account of his suffering during the atonment.
Verse: For behold, I God, have suffered these things for all that they might not suffer if they would repent… which suffering caused myself…to tremble because of pain, and to bleed at every pore… and would that I might not drink the bitter cup… Nevertheless glory be to the father
Context: Martin Harris was the only man in the church who had the funds needed to print the book of Mormon. But it would mean giving up everything. His home, his retirement, everything. As he is struggling with what to do, he asks for a revelation
Consequences: The Lord asks hard things of us and asks us to sacrifice. Martin listened and gave up everything to pay for the printing of the book of Mormon. In spite of everything that comes before and after, Martin Harris should be viewed as a relatable hero.

Summary: The Articles and Covenants of the Church, separated into History, Beliefs, and an outline of the Ordinances.
Context: Joseph asked Oliver to prepare the founding documents for the Church and then Joseph helped tweak with revelation. This document ended up being read at most of the early church conferences. In section 18:3 Oliver was told to rely on the book of mormon and much of this section is a synthesis and/or direct quotation of the book of Mormon
Content: 1-16: Backstory of the church. 17-36: First articles of Faith; what we know. 37-end: Principles of Church organization and structure

Summary: At the organization of the Church, members are told to give heed to the prophet
Content: Give heed unto Joseph Smith the Prophet. When you do, the Lord God will disperse the powers of darkness and cause the Heavens to shake for your good.

Summary: Baptism must be done by proper authority
Verse: Although a man should be baptized an hundred times it availeth him nothing unless done in the New and Everlasting Covenant
Context: Various people wanted to join the Church but didn't want to be re-baptized. The Lord reveals that baptism must be done in the new and everlasting covenant under proper authority

Summary: Synthesis of 5 revelations to 5 people. Hyrum Smith is told that his tongue is loosed, Samuel Smith is called to exhortation and shortly leaves on the mission that will lead to Brigham Young's conversion.
Content: Oliver: Beware of Pride - Oliver would soon make several challenges to prophetic authority. Hyrum: fulfills section 11 by saying "your tongue is loosed" and tells him his duty is to the church. Samuel Smith shortly goes on a mission that will plant the seed for Brigham Young to join the church. Joseph Senior is under no condemnation. Joseph Knight was a quiet introvert and had not joined the church because that would mean serving a mission and declaring the gospel. This duty is referred to as "his cross". Two months after this, he gets baptized.

Summary: Joseph Smith is told to be patient in afflictions, for he shall have many. And in temporal labors he shall not have strength, for that is not his calling
Context: The Church is organized and persecutions are ramping up everywhere. Joseph had to wonder at times how long this could go on. He had been persecuted for 10 years and maybe he wanted to quietly move on with his life now that his work printing the book of Mormon was "done". But the Lord tells him that the ministry will consume the rest of his life.

Summary: Emma Smith is called an elect lady and comforted in her calling as comforter to Joseph Smith
Verse: I will preserve thy life… Thy sins are forgiven and thou art an elect lady … Murmur not because of the things thou hast not seen…Thou shalt expound scripture and exhort the church
Content: The song of the righteous is a prayer unto me

Summary: All things shall be done by common consent in the church, by much prayer and faith.
Verse: You shall let your time be devoted to studying the scriptures… all things shall be done by common consent in the church
Consequences: Ther term for common consent now is sustain. We do sustain in sacrament meeting but we also sustain in the way we live our lives.
Recipient: Joseph Smith, Oliver Cowdery, John Whitmer

Summary: Sacrament in the present and future
Verse: It mattereth not what you shall eat or what you shall drink when ye partake of the sacrament, if it so be that ye do it with an eye single to my glory.
Content: The Lord informs Joseph about the focus of sacrament meeting, prophesies of a millenial sacrament meeting, and outlines the dress code (e.g., the armor of God) for being invited

Summary: Story of Hiram Page - Only the Prophet receives revlation for the Church
Verse: No one shall be appointed to receive commands and revelations in this church excepting my servant Joseph Smith Junior.
Context: Hiram Page was one of the 8 witnesses and Oliver was the second elder and they were deceived. But they were also rescued

Summary: All things unto me are spiritual
Verse: I say unto you that all things unto me are spiritual and not at any time have I given unto you a law which was temporal… Behold I gave unto him that he should be an agent unto himself and I gave unto him commandments
Context: Some were intrigued about the book of Mormon prophect of a Zion in America. And this may also serve to correct some misunderstandings that arose from Hiram Page's seer stone revelations. This revelation occurs around the same time period that Joseph was translating the first few chapters of Genesis, published as the Book of Moses.
Content: This revelation tackles two main questions. (1) Zion, the New Jerusalem, Millenium. (2) Adam, agency, and the premortal life.

Summary: Oliver Cowdery and Peter Whitmer are called to go on a mission and build up the church among the Lamanites
Content: David is chastised for not putting the Lord and ministry as the top priority. Peter will go with Oliver Cowdery to preach to the Lamanites. John is called to preach the gospel
Consequences: They run into political barriers that prevent them from preaching to the Lamanites but this mission leads them to Kirtland.
Recipient: Oliver Cowdery, Peter Whitmer, David Whitmer, John Whitmer

Summary: Thomas B. Marsh - Lift up your heart and rejoice, for the hour of your mission is come
Verse: You have had many afflictions because of your family, nevertheless, I will bless you and your family… Lift up your heart and rejoice for the houst of your mission is come… Pray always, lest you enter into temptation and lose your reward
Consequences: The day I entered the MTC was hard. It was a big transition but it was also exciting. When we first got there, the mission president shared section 31:3 and then we sang the army of Helaman. That was such an incredible spiritual moment and I was close to tears with joy and the Spirit and the emotion of hearing hundreds of voices with new name tags lift your our hearts because the hour of our mission had come.

Summary: Parley P Pratt and Ziba Peterson are called to join Oliver Cowdery and Peter Whitmer on their mission to the Lamanites
Context: Inspired by the Spirit, Parley Pratt left his Ohio homestead in the summer of 1830 and learned of the Book of Mormon while preaching in western New York. He devoured it, became converted, and went in search of Joseph Smith. He first met Joseph around the time of the September conference and there was called to join the mission to the Lamanites.
Consequences: When the mission to the Lamanites is blocked by political red tape, Parley reroutes the group to visit an old friend, Sidney Rigdon, in Kirtland Ohio. They baptize 127 people in 3 weeks. Sometimes the Lord takes us on a path we understand to a destination we cannot imagine.

Summary: Open your mouths and they shall be filled - Ezra Thayre and Northrop Sweet
Verse: Even so will I gather mine elect from the four quarters of the earth.
Content: Section 33:6 was one of President Torgan's mission scriptures. He used it to share that we were participating in God's work and it was our job to invite and God's job to convert.

Summary: Orson Pratt is called to preach the gospel
Consequences: Orson eventually becomes of the original 12 apostles in 1835. His influence on the church cannot be measured. In 1876, he works with Brigham Young to print a new edition of the Doctrine and Covenants and canonizes many personal communications from Joseph Smith.

Summary: Sidney Rigdon is called as scribe
Verse: The Lord says, "I have looked upon thee and thy works. I have heard thy prayers, and prepared thee for a greater work."
Context: Rigdon was the leader of the cambellite congregation in Kirtland. After Parley Pratt and the missionaries teach them the gospel, he and Edward Partridge set out to meet the Prophet

Summary: Edward Partridge is called to preach the gospel with the sound of a trump
Context: Edward Partridge was one of the pillars of the Kirtland community. When the new converts are trying to decide who they trust to go and meet the Prophet and find out if this is true, they choose their pastor (Rigdon) and Partridge because he is a man without guild and they know they can trust him.
Consequences: Partridge is baptized two days after this revelation on December 11. He is called as the first Bishop on Feb 4, 1831 (section 41). He is publically tarred and feathered in Missouri. He dies on May 27, 1840 at 47 years old and his death is mainly attributed to persecutions in Missouri.

Summary: A commandment I give unto the church, that it is expedient in me that they should assemble together at the Ohio
Verse: It is expedient in me that the church should assemble themselves together at the Ohio

Summary: The Lord requires sacrifices to follow him. Move to Ohio, even if it means financial and community loss.
Verse: I commanded you to go to the Ohio, and there I will give unto you my law; and there you shall be endowed with power from on high. And they that have farms that cannot be sold, let them be left or rented as seemeth them good.
Context: How would you react if the Lord told you to give up your retirement plan and everything you have acquired to follow Him? That is essentially what the Lord did when He told them to go to Ohio. The people were scared, so the Lord gave a revelation

Summary: James Covel has been prepared for a greater work and is called not into the Eastern Countries but to the Ohio
James Covel received the word with gladness but the cares of the world caused him to reject the calling. It remaineth with God to do with Covel as seemeth Him good.
Consequences: James Covel did not stay in the Church, but he did spend his life as a successful and faithful minister in New York. Maybe this revelation still applies. We should be kind and give him the grace to know that he could do the Lord's work even from outside the Church.

Summary: Edward Partridge is ordained as Bishop to the Church
Verse: I have called Edward Partridge that he should be ordained a bishop…and spend all his time in the Labors of the Church
Context: The church was commanded to gather to the Ohio so Joseph packs up and moves. When he arrives in Kirtland, he goes up to Newel K. Whitney and says, "Thou art the man… I am the Prophet; You have prayed me here, what do you want?" Sidney Rigdon lost his parishoner house and preacher income and had to restart his life.
Content: Joseph should have a house built… Sidney Rigdon should live as seemeth him good.
Consequences: So much of the Law in section 42 focuses on serving the poor and needy and he Bishop played a huge part in that. He organized all the resources and found housing for the incoming refugees from the east.

Summary: The Law of Consecration, given to the saints in Kirtland Ohio
Verse: The Spirit shall be given unto you by the prayer of faith; and if ye receive not the Spirit ye shall not teach
Content: Thou wilt remember the poor and consecrate of they properties for their support… which thou hast to impart unto them.

Summary: There is none other appointed unto you to receive commandments and revelations until Joseph Smith be taken. Calling to teach come through Church channels instead of personal callings.
Verse: There is none other apointed to receive commanments and revelations until he [Joseph] be taken
Context: When Parley Pratt and Oliver Cowdery taught the gospel, an entire congregation joined. Then they left to teach the Lamanites and the leaders (Rigdon and Partridge) left to go meet Joseph. And all the new converts were left without leadership or support. So Mrs. Hubble steps up and starts to lead them astray with false revelations
Consequences: We do not choose our callings. That helps us focus on God's ministry instead of our own. There are many who claim revelation separate from or ahead of the Prophets. Be careful not to be deceived.

Summary: Missionaries are called to gather and preach in and around Kirtland Ohio
Context: For the law of consecration to work, you need people. You also have all the eastern states coming. So the Lord calls a big transfer meeting. Elders from all over get reassigned to the "Regions round about Kirland" to strengthen the new base of the church

Summary: Signs of the Times - Commentary on Olivet Discourse (Matthew 24, Mark 13, Luke 21)
Verse: Be not troubled for when all these things shall come to pass, ye may know that the promises which have been made unto you shall be fulfilled

Summary: Spiritual Gifts in the Restored Church
Verse: Seek Ye Earnestly the best gifts… they are given for the benefit of those who love me and keep all my commandments and him that seeketh so to do.

Summary: John Whitmer called as Church historian
Verse: It is expedient that John should write and keep a regular history

Summary: Settle in Kirtland for now but save your money for the next move to Zion
Verse: Ye should remain for the present time in your places of abode… save all the money you can … they shall lay the foundation of the city of zion and then ye shall begin to be gathered

Summary: Revelation to the Shakers
Context: There was a large community of Shakers in the area, and Leman Copley was trying to live in his old community and his new community.

Summary: The Spirit of God is Light not Deception
Verse: He that preacheth and he that receiveth understand one another and both are edified and rejoice together

Summary: Saints are made stewards of property
Verse: Let my servant Edward Partridge appoint unto this people their portions according to their circumstances, wants, and needs
Context: Bishop Partridge asked for help in getting the Colesville and other eastern members settled in Kirland.

Summary: Next conference shall be in Missouri, the land of your inheritance. Additionally, many elders are called on missions and given assignments
Verse: Let Joseph Smith and Sidney Rigdon take their journey as soon as preparations can be made and journey to Missouri

Summary: Sidney Gilbert called to Missouri to be an agent unto the Church
Context: Sidney Gilbert moves to Missouri and stays a strong member the rest of his life

Summary: Colesville Saints Called to Missouri
Context: The Colesville Branch was living on Leman Copley's farm (section 51) but Copley goes back to the Shakers (section 49) and kicks them out so they are commanded to go to Missouri

Summary: William W. Phelps called to the work of printing, selecting and writing books for the Church and its children
Context: William W. Phelps was an experienced writer and publisher. He received a book of Mormon from Parley P. Pratt and stayed up all night reading. He became the Church Printer. He left the church between 1839 and 1841 but then came back, moved to Utah, and died while serving as an ordinance worker in the endowment house

Summary: The Lord chastises those who do not follow his commandments with their whole heart. Mission assignments from section 52 need to change because Thayre and Copley are not ready to serve missions
Context: After being called on a mission, Thayre moves slowly and because Leman Copley forced the Colesville Saints to leave, some adjustments to the assignments of section 52 are needed.

Summary: Zion shall be established in Missouri
Content: Joseph and many Elders arrive in Independence and declare that it is the land of Zion

Summary: Men should be anxiously engaged in a good cause - specifically building Zion
Context: You made it to Zion. Now what? Go to work and build with your own hands, using your best judgement. Joseph Smith will be far away and won't be available to consult with rapid answers.

Summary: Zion is a place but also a people who honor God with willing hearts and keep the Sabbath.
Verse: That thou mayest more fully keep thyself unspotted from the world, thou shalt go to the house of prayer and offer up thy sacraments upon my holy day.
Context: Polly Knight, of the Colesville branch, got sick on the journey to Missouri and died shortly after reaching Zion. She was a Zion person and her legacy, in contrast to the Missourians, prompted this relevation about keeping the Sabbath day holy

Summary: Joseph called to return from Missouri to Kirtland - Go Speedily but not in haste
Verse: Thus saith the Lord unto the Elders of His Church who are to return speedily unto the land from whence they came. Let there be a craft made or bought and take your journey from St. Louis then to Cincinnati
Consequences: On August 9, Joseph and 10 other brethren head down the Missouri river on canoes bound for St. Louis

Summary: Waters can be dangerous but God will not forsake us
Verse: None is able to go up to Zion upon the waters but he that is upright in heart. Let them journey two by two

Summary: Some things are left up to your judgement and personal revelation
Verse: Ye are blessed, for the testimony which ye have borne is recorded in heaven and your sins are forgiven you … These things remain with you to do according to judgment and the directions of the Spirit
Context: On the way back to Ohio, Joseph meets a group of missionaries led by Hyrum.
Content: We bring joy to Heaven when our ancestors see us bearing testimony.
Consequences: Hyrum goes to Missouri, holds the meeting discussed in this section and then turns around and goes back to Kirland

Summary: After returning from Zion, Joseph instructs the saints about becoming a Zion people
Verse: To him that keepeth my commandments I will give the mysteries of the Kingdom and the same shall be in him a well of Living Water
Context: Upon returning from Missouri, Joseph has some incredible stories to tell but he finds some discontent and confusion. In response, this revelation outlines many directions concerning sign-seeking, adultery, faith, and keeping the commandments.

Summary: The Prophet makes mistakes but we need to forgive and follw with a willing heart
Verse: There are those who have sought occastion against Joseph Smith without cause… The Lord will forgive whom I will forgive but of you it is required to forgive all men.
Context: Some discontent was forming among some of the members of the church (e.g., Ezra Booth, Symonds Ryder). So the Lord told the saints to forgive the Prophet, forgive each other, and work to build a spiritual and physical Zion
Content: I, the Lord, will retain a stronghold in Kirtland for the space of 5 years. Wherefore be not weary in well-doing for ye are laying the foundation of a great work.

Summary: A prayer for the gospel to fill the Earth
Verse: The Keys of the Kingdom of God are committed unto man on the earth, and from thence shall the gospel roll forth unto the ends of the earth as the stone cut out of the mountain without hands
Context: Joseph said it came by revelation as a kind of prayer. It synthesizes references from Isaiah 33:22, the Lord's Prayer (Matt 6), and Daniel 2:44.

Summary: William E McLellin called to the work
Verse: Blessed are you for receiving mine everlasting covenant, even the fullness of my gospel, sent forth unto the children of men
Context: William McLellin asked the Lord to answer 5 questions through Joseph Smith. Without telling Joseph about the questions, he asked Joseph to provide him God's will.
Consequences: McLellin spent the rest of his long life outside the church, struggling to resolve the tension between his testimony of the revelation and his unwillingness to follow it.

Summary: Preparations to publish the revelations
Verse: (5) Your eyes have been on my servant Joseph Smith Jr. and his imperfections you have known… and you have sought in your hearts knowledge that you might express beyond his language. (6-7) Appoint him that is most wise among you to try to make one like it, then ye are justified in saying that you do not know that they are true.
Context: In preparation to print the book of Commandments and around the same time as sections 1 and 133, some of the elders are hesitant to print their name in connection with the book. The Lord challenges them to try to write a revelation and if they can't, they are commanded to stand as witnesses that the revelations are true.
Consequences: They appoint their best writers, but after many attempts, they acknowledge that Joseph is inspired in the revelations

Summary: Instructions at conference given regarding missionaries, Aaronic Bishops, and Baptism at age 8
Verse: Inasmuch as parents have children in Zion that teach them not to understand [the gospel] when eight years old, the sin be upon the parents.
Context: At a church conference focused on printing the revelations, revelations regarding individuals and church procedure were received. William McLellin was recently ordained to the Priesthood and wanted to know more about it.

Summary: John Whitmer to take revelations to Missouri with Oliver Cowdery
Verse: It is not wisdom in me that [Oliver] should be entrusted with the commandments and the moneys, which he shall carry to the land of Zion, except one go with him
Context: It is time to take the revelations to the printing press in Missouri and that mission needs more people, including the Church Historian

Summary: Stewards of scripture and spiritual things
Verse: I, the Lord, have ordained them to be stewards over the revelations and commandments which I have given unto them.
Content: Joseph Smith Jr., Martin Harris, Oliver Cowdery, John Whitmer, Sidney Rigdon, and W.W. Phelps are given stewardship over the revelations and Spiritual/Doctrinal purity

Summary: The Prophet is called to defend the Church against ex-mormons
Verse: The time has come that it is necessary and expedient that you should proclaim my gospel in the regions round about. Wherefore confound your enemies, call upon them to meet you in public and in private. No weapon that is formed against you shall prosper
Context: Persecution from Ezra Booth and Symonds Ryder is becoming more intense and widespread so Joseph and Sidney Rigdon are called to pause the Bible translation and defend the church against the apostates
Consequences: Joseph does offer to have a public discussion with Booth and Ryder but they turn him down. The mission lasts about 4-6 weeks until he is commanded to resume on January 10.

Summary: Newel K. Whitney called as Bishop and more duties are outlined
Verse: It is expedient for a Bishop to be appointed in this part of the Lord's vineyard (Kirtland). Newel K. Whitney is the man who shall be appointed and ordained… to keep the Lord's storehouse.
Context: Bishop Partridge has been planted in Zion and the Saints in Ohio need a local bishop

Summary: After pausing during the month of December to combat anti-mormon sentiments, Joseph is commanded to resume the bible translation
Verse: It is expedient that [those on missions] should continue preaching the gospel. It is expedient [for Joseph and Sidney] to translate [the Bible] again
Context: After preaching against Ezra Booth's false reports for the past 6 weeks, it is time to return to the Bible translation (see Section 71)

Summary: God clarifies Paul's words and affirms that children are holy
Verse: The apostle wrote a commandment, not of the Lord, but of himself, that a believer should not be united with an unbeliever… Little children are holy, being sanctified through the atonement of Christ
Context: The Lord clarifies 1 Corinthians 7:14 that little children are holy and infant baptism isn't needed. Children should be baptized at age 8 (see Section 68)

Summary: The Lord and the Church will provide for missionary's families
Verse: If ye are faithful [missionaries], ye shall be laden with many sheaves and crowned with eternal life. It is the duty of the Church to support the families of those who are called to proclaim my gospel.
Context: At a church conference , the Lord calls 24 men on missions during the next summer. As a church of farmers, they knew they would miss out on the whole season. So the Lord promises to take care of their families if they have the faith to go.

Summary: A vision of the Degrees of Glory
Verse: And now, after the many testimonies which have been given of him, this is the testimony, last of all, which we give of him, that He lives! For we saw him, even on the right hand of God.
Context: While working on the new testament, it became clear to Joseph that many plain and precious things were missing and THE VISION was given

Summary: Keys to understand the book of Revelations
Context: While working on the bible translation, the Lord revealed the meaning of symbols to help understand the book of Revelations

Summary: The Church leaders start the United Firm
Verse: It must needs be that there be an organization of my people, in regulating the affairs of the storehouse for the poor of my people. For if ye are not equal in earthly things, ye cannot be equal in heavenly things
Context: The church leaders need an official business structure to combine the temporal affairs of the church (store, printing press, etc.)
Consequences: In this section, Joseph is told to travel to Missouri to help unify the leaders. He goes and gets there in April 1832 (section 82).

Summary: Jared Carter called to mission again
Context: Jared Carter was baptized in Colesville and moved to Ohio with the Colesville saints. He served various missions to the eastern states. His friends turned against him and his faith but he baptized 79 people between 1831 and 1834.
Consequences: Jared Carter shows up in Lucy Mack Smith's history by serving a mission in Detroit and baptizing the Deacon. Eventually, Carter makes it to Nauvoo but then says that the Spirit left him and he just quietly leaves the Church
Approximate: 79 to 89 - Various Church Administration and Laws

Summary: Stephen Burnett called to preach
Verse: Thus saith the Lord unto Stephen Burnett, go ye into the world and preach the gospel. Wherefore, go ye and preach my gospel, whether to the North, South, East, or West, it mattereth not, for ye cannot go amiss.
Context: Stephen Burnett was 17 or 18 at this time and ready to preach. He was baptize in Oct 1831 and first called to serve in Jan 1832. This revelation in March tells him to go with Eden Smith (who gets sick). So two weeks later, Burnett leaves to preach with Eden's father.
Content: Don't get caught up in your mission assignment. Your assignment, location, or language can change. Focus on what to preach, not where or how
Consequences: Burnett eventually leaves the church during the Kirtland apostasy in 1838
Approximate: 79 to 89 - Various Church Administration and Laws

Summary: Instructions for counselors of Prophets
Verse: Inasmuch as thou art faithful in counsel, in prayer always in public and in private, in [supporting the prophet], thou will do the greatest good unto they fellow beings
Consequences: Frederick G. Williams was faithful as a top leader from 1830-1837. He left after the Kirtland Safety Society scandal but came back in 1840. He was faithful until his death 2 years later
Approximate: 79 to 89 - Various Church Administration and Laws

Summary: The Lord is bound by obedience
Verse: Inasmuch as you have forgiven one another your trespasses, even so I, the Lord, forgive you. For of him unto whom much is given, much is required… I, the Lord, am bound when ye do what I say but when ye do not what I say, you have no promise
Context: In response to section 78, Joseph travelled to Missouri. But right before he left, Joseph was torn from his house in the middle of the night to be tarred and feathered, leaving Joseph Murdock exposed to the cold while already sick with measles; leading to his death. Sidney Rigdon also received a head injury he never really recovered from.
Approximate: 79 to 89 - Various Church Administration and Laws

Summary: Responsibility for the widows, orphans, and poor
Verse: And the widows and orphans shall be provided for [from the storehouse], as also the poor
Approximate: 79 to 89 - Various Church Administration and Laws

Summary: Oath and Covenant of the Priesthood
Verse: Whoso is faithful in obtaining these two priesthoods…. Are sanctified by the Spirit unto the renewing of their bodies
Context: Elders were returning from their section 75 missions and sharing their experiences at a conference. Joseph received this revelation on the Priesthood, Covenants, and Temples.
Approximate: 79 to 89 - Various Church Administration and Laws

Summary: To receive church blessings, you must live church laws
Verse: For those saints who do not participate in consecration will not have their names on the records of the church… The man that putteth forth his hand to steady the ark of God shall fall by the shaft of death
Context: The church in Missouri has been receiving a large influx of people. Missouri was meant to be a place of consecration but some saints were not consecrating.
Approximate: 79 to 89 - Various Church Administration and Laws

Summary: Parable of the Wheat and Tares
Verse: Let the wheat and tares growth together until the harvest, then you can separate them tares for burning
Context: While working on the Bible translation, the Lord expounded on the parable of the wheat and tares
Approximate: 79 to 89 - Various Church Administration and Laws

Summary: Joseph predicts Civil War
Verse: Wars will shortly come to pass, beginning at South Carolina… Wherefore stand ye in holy places and be not moved.
Context: At this time, South Carolina came close to rebelling against the federal government. It was resolved, at least for the next few decades but the Lord warned the saints of the impending conflict
Approximate: 79 to 89 - Various Church Administration and Laws

Summary: Olive leaf plucked from the tree of paradise
Verse: As all have not faith, seek ye diligently and teach one another words of wisdom, seek ye out of the best books words of wisdom. Establish a house of prayer, fasting, faith, learning, glory, a house of order, a house of God.
Approximate: 79 to 89 - Various Church Administration and Laws

Summary: Word of Wisdom
Verse: Saints shall receive health in their navel and marrow to their bones, and shall find wisdom and great treasures of knowledge, and shall run and not be weary and shall walk and not faint.
Context: The United States was questioning the health implications of alcohol and tobacco. Meanwhile Emma raised concerns about cleanliness in holy chambers, leading to this revelation.
Consequences: In 1921, adherence to the word of wisdom was added to temple recommend interviews
Approximate: 79 to 89 - Various Church Administration and Laws

Summary: Authority of First Presidency is established
Verse: [The counselors of the First Presidency] are accounted as equal with [Joseph] in holding the keys of the last kingdom
Context: Since section 81 in March 1832, the Presidency of the High Priesthood has evolved and is ready for the next step. Joseph was made President in November 1831
Approximate: 90 to 96 - Various Kirtland mangement and temple

Summary: Instructions about the Apocrypha
Verse: There are many things contained [in the Apocrypha] that are true…whoso is enlightened by the Spirit shall obtain benefit therefrom
Context: In section 90:13, Joseph was commanded to continue his bible translation. Joseph asks about whether the apocrypha should be included
Content: The Apocrphya does not need to be translated
Approximate: 90 to 96 - Various Kirtland mangement and temple

Summary: Frederick G. Williams joins United Firm
Verse: I command that you receive Frederick G. Williams into the Order… [To Williams:] Inasmuch as ye are faithful in keeping all former commandments, you shall be blessed forever
Approximate: 90 to 96 - Various Kirtland mangement and temple

Summary: Jesus grew from grace to grace
Verse: Jesus received not of the fullness at first but continued from grace to grace, until he received a fulness…. You shall receive grace for grace until you have a fulness…Truth is knowledge of things are they are, were, and are to come.
Consequences: Little is known about the context for this section, but the consequences are immeasurable. This section is the basis for our belief in eternal exaltation and becoming Gods. It is foundational for agency and our roots as organized inteligence
Approximate: 90 to 96 - Various Kirtland mangement and temple

Summary: Hyrum, Reynolds Cahoon, and Jared Carter form the building committee
Verse: Smith, Cahoon, and Carter shall receive land for their inheritance
Consequences: Reynolds Cahoon lives and dies a faithful member and leader in the church
Recipient: Hyrum Smith, Reynolds Cahoon, Jared Carter
Approximate: 90 to 96 - Various Kirtland mangement and temple

Summary: The Lord commands to start building a temple in Kirtland
Verse: Whom I love I chasten… Ye have sinned against me by not considering the commandment to build a temple
Consequences: Within a few days, Joseph, Hyrum, Brigham, and Cahoon start to build the temple
Approximate: 90 to 96 - Various Kirtland mangement and temple

Summary: Stewardship of the Peter French Farm
Verse: Let Newel K. Whitney take charge of the place… It is expedient that John Johnson become a member of the order
Context: The last few days have been a whirlwind of temple prep. They found and purchased land for $11,000 and will break ground on June 5. They meet to discuss stewardship of the land, known as the Peter French farm
Approximate: 90 to 96 - Various Kirtland mangement and temple

Summary: Observe their covenants by sacrifice
Verse: All among them that are willing to observe their covenants by sacrifice, which I the Lord will command, they are accepted of me… This is the tithing and the sacrifice which I, the Lord, require at their hands, that there may be a house built for me [in the land of Zion]
Context: The Prophet is 800 miles away and asks for information on Missouri. He doesn't know that on July 23, the Saints were forced to sign an agreement to leave Jackson County
Content: Inasmuch as my people build a house unto me… my glory shall rest upon it… I, the Lord, have accepted of [Zion's offering]

Summary: Be not afraid of your enemies
Verse: All things wherewith you have been afflicted shall work together for your good… If men smite you, or your families and ye bear it patiently, neither seek revenge, ye shall be rewarded. I, the Lord, will fight your battles
Context: Comes in consequence of the persecutions in Missouri. These saints had been abused and wanted revenge. Joseph might have known some of what was happening but he certainly didn't know everything

Summary: John Murdock called to Eastern States
Verse: John Murdock, thou art called to go into the eastern countires to proclaim my everlasting gospel… It is not expedient that you should go until your children are provided for
Context: In April 1832, Joseph Smith was pulled from his home, leaving young Joseph Murdock (11 months) exposed to the elements, leading to his measles getting worse and killing him. John Murdock was on a mission in Missouri at the time (section 52) and spent a month bedridden with sickness himself. While his 4 other children were cared for by friends. In August, he is called again to leave them. That would take a lot of faith.
Consequences: Joseph Murdock saw a vision of the Savior during the winter of 1832-1833, served in Zion's camp, served on the high council (Missouri and Utah), Bishop (Nauvoo and Utah), Mission President (Australia), and as a Patriarch (Lehi and Beaver)

Summary: The Lord protects Joseph's family while he is on a mission to New York
Verse: Your families are well; they are in my hands. I, the Lord, have suffered you to come unto this place for the salvation of many souls.
Context: Joseph and Sidney were on a mission to Canada and the eastern states and were worried about their families. The Lord also discusses the redemption of Zion.
Consequences: This three week mission ends in a small but growing number of faithful saints. 2 years later, Parley P. Pratt goes back to this region and goes with Freeman Nickerson to Toronto and there meets and baptizes John Taylor and Mary Fielding. John Taylor is from the British Isles and after his conversion, he writes his family, which opens the way for the eventual British mission, which in many ways, saves the Church from extinction.

Summary: God will be with those in persecution
Verse: Let your hearts by comforted concerning Zion; for all flesh is in mine hands; Be still and know that I am God.
Context: Since July 1833, persecutions have increased. More than 1,000 saints were driven from Jackson county and more than 200 homes were burned. Joseph sought revelation about why this was happening

Summary: Kirtland High Council organized
Verse: A council of 24 high priests assembled… for the purpose of settling important difficulties.
Context: The Lord has often created councils in His church. This revelation is the minutes of the first meeting of the Kirtland High Council

Summary: Zion's camp is established
Verse: The redemption of Zion must needs come by power … Let no man be afraid to lay down his life for my sake
Context: Parley P. Pratt and Lyman Wight arrive to ask Joseph for help.
Consequences: After this revelation, Joseph asks for volunteers and an army of 300 to march to Zion

Summary: United Firm reorganized into stewardships
Verse: Therefore a commandment I give unto you that ye shall organize yourselves and appoint every man his stewardship… The earth is full; there is enough and to spare. I have given to men to be agents unto themselves.
Context: Because of persecution in Missouri, financial resources were beginning to strain. And certain members were not consecrating all. So the Lord reorganizes the United Firm into individual stewardships

Summary: The end of Zion's Camp --> Focus on the temple
Verse: Redemption of Zion will wait until the people are prepared and they are endowed with power… I do not require at their hands to figure the battles of zion.
Context: The governor of Missouri removed his promise of help via the state militia, Joseph chose not to start a war against the law. He used funds to help Missouri saints and disbanded Zion's camp. This revelation reframes the redemption of Zion to be temple focused.
Consequences: Brigham Young: We got everything we went for.

Summary: Warren Cowdery called to the work
Verse: Warren Cowdery should be appointed and ordained a presiding high priest over my church in Freedom, New York

Summary: Organization of Priesthood Quorums
Verse: Let every man learn his duty and act in the office in which he is appointed
Context: Quorum of 12 apostles were called and ordained between February and April 1835. They were instructed to spend the summer traveling and strengthening the church (by leaving May 4).
Content: 2 Priesthoods; Melchizedek is for spiritual blessings in the church, Aaronic is for outward ordinances.

Summary: Lyman Sherman given instruction
Verse: Let your soul be at rest concerning your spiritual standing… Strengthen your brethren in conversation, prayer, exhortation, and all your doings
Context: Lyman Sherman joined the church in New York in January 1832 and moved to Kirtland in 1833. He marched in Zion's camp (May 1834) and was called as one of the 7 presidents over the sevent (February 1835). Then spent the summer 1835 traveling and preaching

Summary: Dedication of the Kirtland temple
Verse: And as all have not faith, seek ye diligently and teach one another words of wisdom; yea, seek ye out of the best books words of wisdom, seek learning even by study and also by faith; Organize yourselves; prepare every needful thing, and establish a house, even a house of prayer, a house of fasting, a house of faith, a house of learning, a house of glory, a house of order, a house of God;

Summary: Christ and Prophets come to Kirtland temple
Verse: We saw the Lord standing on the pulpit… [saying] Behold I have accepted this house
Content: Moses, Elias, Elijah all came and bestowed Priesthood keys to Joseph and Oliver

Summary: Joseph looking for treasure in Salem
Verse: I have much treasure in this city for the benefit of Zion … Concern not yourselves about your debts for I will give you power to pay them.
Context: Joseph and other leaders had gone to Salem in search of treasure to alleviate debts from the Kirtland temple
Approximate: 111 to 120 - Transition from Ohio to Missouri

Summary: Message to Marsh and the 12 amid Kirtland Safety Society and England Mission
Verse: Be thou humble and the Lord shall lead thee by the hand and give thee answer to thy prayers
Context: The church is in a period of strife (Kirtland Safety Society) and contention and that includes the quorum of the 2. This direction is to that quorum, even as many are preaching in England
Recipient: Thomas B. Marsh; Quorum of the 12
Approximate: 111 to 120 - Transition from Ohio to Missouri

Summary: Answers on the writings of Isaiah
Context: Joseph has moved to Missouri after the Kirtland apostasy and teaches prophecy
Content: Joseph sees himself as a servant that is coming from Jesus Christ
Approximate: 111 to 120 - Transition from Ohio to Missouri

Summary: David Patten should settle his affairs and prepare to serve
Verse: It is wisdom that David Patten should settle up all his business as soon as he can that he may perform a mission unto me next spring
Context: Patten was an apostle in Missouri. He is told to settle his affairs and prepare for a mission in the spring.
Consequences: He is killed by mob violence in the fall but is prepared because he listened to the propet
Approximate: 111 to 120 - Transition from Ohio to Missouri

Summary: Saints given the name of the Church
Verse: Thus shall my church be called in the last days, even the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
Context: Everyone is worried about the future of the Church. Kirtland is lost. Jackson county is lost. So the Lord reminds them who is in charge and urges them to prepare to build temples, wherever they are.
Approximate: 111 to 120 - Transition from Ohio to Missouri

Summary: Adam-Ondi-Ahman identified
Verse: Sprint Hill is named by the Lord Adam-Ondi-Ahman where he shall come to visit his people
Context: Joseph and other leaders explored surroudning areas and found Adam-Ondi-Ahman where Adam, the ancient of days, lived
Approximate: 111 to 120 - Transition from Ohio to Missouri

Summary: Settle business and leave Kirtland.
Verse: What is property unto me? Do not covet that which is but a drop
Context: Most saints had left Kirtland but a few had stayed, torn between their prosperity and their faith. This revelation urges them to choose faith and join the saints
Recipient: William Marks, Newel K. Whitney, Oliver Granger
Approximate: 111 to 120 - Transition from Ohio to Missouri

Summary: New apostles called after Kirtland apostasy
Context: Four of the original apostles had been excommunicated or removed. This revelation calls new apostles to fill the vacancy
Content: John Taylor, John E. Page, Wilford Woodruff, and Willard Richards called to the 12.
Approximate: 111 to 120 - Transition from Ohio to Missouri

Summary: Law of Tithing
Verse: They shall pay one tenth of their interest annually and this shall be a standing law to the Church
Context: The Bishops had started to ask for more consistent donations and Joseph asks for guidance on the amount. The previous thought was around 2% of net worth annually.
Approximate: 111 to 120 - Transition from Ohio to Missouri

Summary: Council of the Tithes established
Verse: Tithing shall be disposed of by a council composed of the First Presidency, Bishop, and High Council, and by My own voice
Approximate: 111 to 120 - Transition from Ohio to Missouri

Summary: Liberty Jail pt 1 - Peace be unto thy soul
Verse: O God, where are Thou? My son, peace be unto thy soul. Thine adversity and thine affliction shall be but a small moment. ….. How long can rolling waters remain impure? The rights of the priesthood are inseparably connected with the powers of heaven…. No power or influence ought to be maintained by virtue of the priesthood only by persuasion and long-suffering... Let virtue garnish thy thoughts unceasingly
Context: In the fall of 1838, mob violence was gtting worse and governor boggs said the mormons must fight their own battles. In mid-October, church members fought back and Apostle David Patten was killed at Crooked River. Governor Boggs issued the extermination order and a mob attacked Haun's Mill on October 30. On October 31, General Lucas laid siege to Far West and arrested Joseph Smith. Saved from execution by Alexander Doniphan, they spent a month in a jail in Richmond before being sent to Liberty on December 1. Meanwhile, the rest of the saints are forced out to Illinois. The prisoners are released/escape on April 6, 1839.
Approximate: 121 to 130 - Transition from Liberty Jail to Nauvoo

Summary: Liberty Jail pt 2 - All these things shall give thee experience and shall be for thy Good.
Verse: Know thou my son that all these shall give thee experience and shall be for thy good. The son of man hath descended below them all. Art thou greater than he?
Context: In the fall of 1838, mob violence was gtting worse and governor boggs said the mormons must fight their own battles. In mid-October, church members fought back and Apostle David Patten was killed at Crooked River. Governor Boggs issued the extermination order and a mob attacked Haun's Mill on October 30. On October 31, General Lucas laid siege to Far West and arrested Joseph Smith. Saved from execution by Alexander Doniphan, they spent a month in a jail in Richmond before being sent to Liberty on December 1. Meanwhile, the rest of the saints are forced out to Illinois. The prisoners are released/escape on April 6, 1839.
Approximate: 121 to 130 - Transition from Liberty Jail to Nauvoo

Summary: Liberty Jail pt 3 - Make a record the the persecution
Content: We have an imperative duty to the widows and orphans to waste and wear out our lives in bringing to light all the hidden things of darkness
Approximate: 121 to 130 - Transition from Liberty Jail to Nauvoo

Summary: Charter for Nauvoo, a cornerstone of Zion
Verse: Build a house unto my name, a house for boarding strangers in the Cornerstone of Zion
Context: Since Joseph escaped Missouri in April 1839, the saints have been busy building Nauvoo. This revelation serves as a charter for Nauvoo, a Cornerstone of Zion
Content: The Lord loves Hyrum because of the integrity of his heart. Let Hyrum take the office of Patriarch. Brigham Young to be a president of the 12.
Approximate: 121 to 130 - Transition from Liberty Jail to Nauvoo

Summary: Saints in Iowa Territory
Verse: What is the will of the Lord concerning the Saints in the territory of Iowa? Let them gather together unto the places which I shall appoint and build up a city named Zarahemla
Context: After leaving Missouri, the Saints ran to Illinois and Iowa. Nauvoo became the main headquarters but many saints lived just over the river in Iowa. Zarahemla had a stake (Aug 14) until the need for labor on the temple brought saints to Nauvoo (Jan 1842)
Approximate: 121 to 130 - Transition from Liberty Jail to Nauvoo

Summary: Brigham Young to stay in Nauvoo to care for his family
Verse: It is not longer required at your hand to leave your family… Take especial care of your family
Context: Brigham had been on and off missions since joining the Church, including 22 months in the British mission. His wife and children struggled in poverty while he was gone. This revelation is as much a recognition of Mary Ann's sacrifice as Brigham's
Approximate: 121 to 130 - Transition from Liberty Jail to Nauvoo

Summary: Baptisms for the dead need a record
Verse: When you are baptized for the dead, let there be a recorder and eye-witness
Context: After an assassintation attempt on Gov. Boggs, Joseph goes into hiding but sends instructions on Baptisms for the dead, which was in practice since August 1840.
Approximate: 121 to 130 - Transition from Liberty Jail to Nauvoo

Summary: Shall we not go on in so great a cause
Verse: It may seem to some to be a very bold doctrine, a power which records and binds on Earth and Heaven… They without us cannot be made perfect neither we without them … Shall we not go on in so great a cause?
Context: In January 1836, Joseph saw Alvin in the Celestial Kingdom, though he had not been baptized. Over the years, the ordinance was revealed line upon line until going public in August 1840 at a funeral
Approximate: 121 to 130 - Transition from Liberty Jail to Nauvoo

Summary: Shaking hands with Angels / detecting whether a message is from God
Verse: This is how you know if an angel is sent from God
Context: Joseph delivered instructions to guests in his house. It was a casual conversation but Orson and Parley Pratt thought it significant and wrote it down
Approximate: 121 to 130 - Transition from Liberty Jail to Nauvoo

Summary: Insights into God and Heaven
Verse: When the Savior appears, we shall see him as he is … The same sociality which exists among us here will exist in Heaven, coupled with eternal glory…Whatever principle of intelligence we attain unto in this life, it will rise with us in the resurrection... When we obtain any blessing from God, it is by obedience to the law ... The father has a body of flesh and bones
Context: Orson Hyde gave a sermon and later that day, Joseph offered some corrections
Approximate: 121 to 130 - Transition from Liberty Jail to Nauvoo

Summary: Three levels of Celestial Kingdom
Verse: In the celestial glory, there are three heavens or degrees, and in order to obtain the highest, you must enter into the new and everlasting covenant of marriage… It is impossible for a man to be saved in ignorance
Context: William Clayton wrote in his journal some profound conversations he had with Joseph
Approximate: 131 to 138 - Transition from Nauvoo to Salt Lake

Summary: Eternal and Plural Marriage
Context: Plural marriage was starting to be practiced. Hyrum, initially opposed became convinced of the law. He offered to try to convince Emma if Joseph would write a revelation. Emma, when Hyrum read this revelation to her, burned it in the fire.
Content: Marriage can be eternal through priesthood keys… Those who keep covenants will pass sentinels to their exaltation, then they shall be Gods
Approximate: 131 to 138 - Transition from Nauvoo to Salt Lake

Summary: Appendix to the book of Commandments
Verse: Be ye clean that bear the vessels of the Lord… The graves of the saints shall be opened
Context: See section 1
Approximate: 131 to 138 - Transition from Nauvoo to Salt Lake

Summary: Declaration regarding governments
Context: In 1835, a group of leaders met to outline their attitude toward Government, likely related to treatment of the Saints in Jackson County. It was adopted by the Joseph and the Church a few weeks later.
Content: Governments were instituted of God… There should be freedom of religion and the separation of church and state
Approximate: 131 to 138 - Transition from Nauvoo to Salt Lake

Summary: Martyrdom of Joseph Smith
Verse: Joseph and Hyrum sealed their testimony with their blood… Joseph Smith has done more, save Jesus only, for the salvation of men in this world… The book of Mormon cost the best blood of the 19th century.
Context: Joseph was killed in Carthage
Approximate: 131 to 138 - Transition from Nauvoo to Salt Lake

Summary: Journey westward will be led by the Lord and the Quorum of the 12 Apostles
Verse: The word and will of the Lord for the camp of Israel
Context: In early 1846, Brigham intended to cross the plains and settle in the west in a few months. A year later, the Saints were spread out along the muddy plains of Iowa, feeling scared and stuck. The revelation shows that God is with Brigham as the prophet and will help the Church find a home in the west
Approximate: 131 to 138 - Transition from Nauvoo to Salt Lake

Summary: All those who would have received it… Joseph sees Alvin in Heaven
Verse: All those who have died without a knowledge of this gospel, who would have received it…shall be heirs of the Celestial Kingdom of God
Context: The Kirtland temple was almost finished and elders of the Church performed washing and anointings. It was a day filled with spiritual outpourings and Joseph had a vision of Alvin in the Celestial Kingdom
Content: Joseph saw Alvin, which confused him because Alvin died without baptism by proper authority
Approximate: 131 to 138 - Transition from Nauvoo to Salt Lake

Summary: Vision of the Redemption of the Dead
Verse: Christ preached the gospel unto the Spirits in Prison…. The dead who repent will be redeemed, through obedience to the ordinances of the House of God
Context: Joseph F. was born when Hyrum was imprisoned in Liberty Jail. He was the last prophet to know Joseph Smith, who died when he was 6. Decades later, World War I had been ravaging the world. The 1918 influenza pandemic was starting, and Joseph's son and daughter-in-law had recently died, leaving behind five young children as orphans
Consequences: This is another huge step toward temples as we know it
Approximate: 131 to 138 - Transition from Nauvoo to Salt Lake
